|Keyed.BreakRiskMinor=Minor break risk
|Keyed.BreakRiskMajor=Major break risk
|Keyed.BreakRiskExtreme=Extreme break risk
|Keyed.BreakRiskMinorDesc=These colonists are in a poor mood and may have a minor mental break at any time:<br/><br/>{0}
|Keyed.BreakRiskMajorDesc=These colonists are in a very poor mood and may have a major mental break at any time:<br/><br/>{0}
|Keyed.BreakRiskExtremeDesc=These colonists are critically stressed and may have an extreme (and possibly violent) mental break at any moment:<br/><br/>{0}
|Keyed.BreakRiskDescEnding=Check these colonists' Needs tab to see what's bothering them.<br/><br/>To make colonists feel better, you can do things like make them fancy meals, give them more joy hours per day and nicer joy objects, place them in beautiful environments, have them drink and smoke, and much more.
|Keyed.ColonistNeedsRescue=Colonist needs rescue
|Keyed.ColonistsNeedRescue=Colonists need rescue
|Keyed.ColonistsNeedRescueDesc=  These colonists are incapacitated on the ground:<br/><br/>{0}<br/>Send another colonist to rescue them and carry them back to bed.<br/><br/>(To rescue, select another colonist, then right click on the victim and select Rescue.
|Keyed.NeedDefenses=Need defenses
|Keyed.NeedDefensesDesc=You've been here some time and have probably been seen. Pirate raids will start soon.<br/><br/>You should prepare defenses, whether they're traps, sandbags, or turrets.
|Keyed.NeedDoctor=Need doctor
|Keyed.NeedDoctorDesc=These colonists need medical care, but you have no healthy colonists assigned as doctors.<br/><br/>{0}<br/>Assign a healthy colonist to the Doctor work type. If left untreated, wounds may never heal properly and may become permanent.
|Keyed.NeedMiner=Need miner
|Keyed.NeedMinerDesc=You have designated some rocks to be mined, but no colonist has the Mining work type.<br/><br/>Assign a colonist the Mining work type.
|Keyed.NeedWarden=Need warden
|Keyed.NeedWardenDesc=You have a prisoner, but no colonist has the Warden work type.<br/><br/>Assign a colonist the Warden work type.
|Keyed.LowFood=Low food
|Keyed.LowFoodDesc=You are dangerously low on food.<br/><br/>    Full bars worth of food in storage: {0}<br/>    Colonists and prisoners getting food: {1}<br/>    Days worth of food in storage: {2}<br/><br/>Grow, buy, find, or kill some food.
|Keyed.LowMedicine=Low medicine
|Keyed.LowMedicineDesc=You only have {0} medications left in storage.<br/><br/>Buy more medicine from traders.
|Keyed.NoMedicineDesc=You have no medicine left in storage.<br/><br/>Buy more medicine from traders.
|Keyed.NeedColonistBeds=Need colonist beds
|Keyed.NeedColonistBedsDesc=You have more colonists than you have colonist beds. Someone will lack a place to sleep.<br/><br/>Either make more beds, or change a prisoner bed to a colonist bed.<br/><br/>If you have no resources, sleeping spots are free and can be placed instantly.
|Keyed.HunterLacksWeapon=Hunter lacks ranged weapon
|Keyed.HunterLacksWeaponDesc=A colonist is assigned as a hunter but does not have a ranged weapon.<br/><br/>They will not hunt until they are carrying a ranged weapon.
|Keyed.AlertTatteredApparel=Tattered apparel
|Keyed.AlertTatteredApparelDesc=These colonists are wearing tattered apparel, which is making them sad:<br/><br/>{0}<br/>Get them some apparel that isn't so badly damaged.<br/><br/>You can tailor apparel at a tailoring table, or buy it from traders.
|Keyed.AlertUnhappyNudity=Unhappy nudity
|Keyed.AlertUnhappyNudityDesc=These colonists are nude and not happy about it:<br/><br/>{0}<br/>Get them some clothes.<br/><br/>You can tailor apparel at a tailoring table, or buy it from traders.
|Keyed.Starvation=Starvation
|Keyed.StarvationDesc=These colonists are starving:<br/><br/>{0}<br/>Get them some food.
|Keyed.StarvationAnimals=Animal starvation
|Keyed.StarvationAnimalsDesc=These colony animals are starving:<br/><br/>{0}<br/>Get them some food.
|Keyed.Exhaustion=Exhaustion
|Keyed.ExhaustionDesc=These colonists are exhausted and need rest:<br/><br/>{0}<br/>Get them some rest. They'll need a bed marked for colonist use. Also, make sure they're not drafted.
|Keyed.NeedFoodHopper=Need food hopper
|Keyed.NeedFoodHopperDesc=You have a nutrient dispenser with no hopper next to it.<br/><br/>To work, paste dispensers must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with raw food.<br/><br/>Build a hopper adjacent to the dispenser.
|Keyed.NeedMealSource=Need meal source
|Keyed.NeedMealSourceDesc=You have no way of preparing proper meals from raw food.<br/><br/>Build a stove, campfire, or nutrient dispenser.<br/><br/>(It cannot be in a prison cell, otherwise colonists cannot use it.)
|Keyed.NeedJoySource=Need joy source
|Keyed.NeedJoySourceDesc=Your colonists need to fulfill their joy need, but you haven't built any joy sources.<br/><br/>Help them by building a horseshoes pin, chess table, or other joy source.
|Keyed.NeedBatteries=Need batteries
|Keyed.NeedBatteriesDesc=You have a solar or wind generator, but no batteries. This means you'll lose power every time the sun goes down or the wind calms.<br/><br/>Build a battery or two to guarantee sustained power.
|Keyed.BrawlerHasRangedWeapon=Brawler has ranged weapon
|Keyed.BrawlerHasRangedWeaponDesc=One of your colonists has the Brawler personality trait, but is carrying a ranged weapon. This will make them very unhappy.
|Keyed.ShieldUserHasRangedWeapon=Shield user has ranged weapon
|Keyed.ShieldUserHasRangedWeaponDesc=One of your colonists has a shield belt and is carrying a ranged weapon. They will not be able to fire their weapon through the shield (except at targets who are already touching them).
|Keyed.NeedResearchProject=Need research project
|Keyed.NeedResearchProjectDesc=You have the equipment to do research but have not selected a project.<br/><br/>Open the research menu and select a project.
|Keyed.ColonistsIdle={0} colonists idle
|Keyed.ColonistsIdleDesc=These colonists are wandering idly:<br/><br/>{0}<br/>You should probably find them something productive to do.
|Keyed.ColonistNeedsTreatment=Colonist needs treatment
|Keyed.ColonistNeedsTreatmentDesc=These colonists need medical treatment. Without it, they may die of their wounds, or their wounds may become permanent.<br/><br/>{0}<br/>Treat them by sending them to a medical bed.<br/><br/>(First, assign a medical bed by selecting it and toggling it into a medical bed. Then, select the wounded colonists and right-click on the medical bed to make them a patient.)
|Keyed.AlertHypothermia=Hypothermia
|Keyed.AlertHypothermiaDesc=These colonists are suffering from hypothermia.<br/><br/>{0}<br/>Make sure their clothing is appropriate for the season and that indoor spaces are properly heated.
|Keyed.PatientsAwaitingMedicalOperation={0} patients await medical operation
|Keyed.PatientsAwaitingMedicalOperationDesc=These patients await medical operation:<br/><br/>{0}<br/>Make sure you have all necessary medical tools and a free doctor available.
|Keyed.FireInHomeArea=Fire!
|Keyed.FireInHomeAreaDesc=There is a fire in the home area.
|Keyed.PawnsWithLifeThreateningDisease=Severe illness
|Keyed.PawnsWithLifeThreateningDiseaseDesc=People are at risk of death because of severe illness:<br/><br/>{0}<br/>Make sure that they get the best medical possible.
|Keyed.PawnsWithLifeThreateningDiseaseAmputationDesc=People are at risk for death because of severe illness:<br/><br/>{0}<br/>If possible, consider amputating or replacing infected limbs in order to keep colonists alive.
|Keyed.BilliardsNeedsSpace=Billiards needs space
|Keyed.BilliardsNeedsSpaceDesc=One of your billiards table is adjacent to an obstruction that will prevent colonists from using it.<br/><br/>A billiards table needs clear space around it on all sides to be usable.
|Keyed.HunterHasShieldAndRangedWeapon=Hunter has shield and ranged weapon
|Keyed.HunterHasShieldAndRangedWeaponDesc=One of your hunters is using a ranged weapon and wearing a shield belt which prevents shooting at range.<br/><br/>They won't be able to hunt unless the shield is removed.
|Keyed.NeedWarmClothes=Need warm clothes
|Keyed.NeedWarmClothesDesc1=At least {0} of your colonists will lack warm clothes when the cold season comes.
|Keyed.NeedWarmClothesDesc1All=All of your colonists will lack warm clothes when the cold season comes.
|Keyed.NeedWarmClothesDesc2=The outdoor temperature is going to reach {0}.<br/><br/>You can tailor warm clothes at the tailoring bench, or buy them from traders.
|Keyed.ImmobileCaravan=Immobile caravan
|Keyed.ImmobileCaravanDesc=One of your caravans is immobile because it carries too much.<br/><br/>You can make the caravan mobile again by abandoning some items in the ITEMS tab.

|Keyed.DesignatorCutPlants=Cut plants
|Keyed.DesignatorCutPlantsDesc=Marks plants to be cut and destroyed. The plant will be completely removed, and any food or resource yield will be harvested.
|Keyed.DesignatorDeconstruct=Deconstruct
|Keyed.DesignatorDeconstructDesc=Deconstruct this and reclaim part of its resources.
|Keyed.DesignatorUninstall=Uninstall
|Keyed.DesignatorUninstallDesc=Uninstall this so it can be moved, sold, or installed somewhere else.
|Keyed.DesignatorHarvest=Harvest
|Keyed.DesignatorHarvestDesc=Marks plants to be harvested for their food or other products.
|Keyed.DesignatorHarvestWood=Chop wood
|Keyed.DesignatorHarvestWoodDesc=Marks trees to be chopped down for wood.
|Keyed.DesignatorHaulThings=Haul things
|Keyed.DesignatorHaulThingsDesc=Mark rock chunks and other items to be hauled to dumping areas. Not needed for things like food or corpses, which are always haulable.
|Keyed.MustHaulHaulables=Can only designate haulable but non-always-hauled things (like rock chunks).
|Keyed.DesignatorHunt=Hunt
|Keyed.DesignatorHuntDesc=Mark animals to be hunted by your hunters.
|Keyed.DesignatorMine=Mine
|Keyed.DesignatorMineDesc=Designate areas of rock to be mined out.
|Keyed.DesignatorSmoothFloor=Smooth floor
|Keyed.DesignatorSmoothFloorDesc=Designate rough stone terrain to be smoothed.
|Keyed.DesignatorPlan=Plan
|Keyed.DesignatorPlanDesc=Place planning designations. These don't do anything except help you plan future expansions.
|Keyed.DesignatorPlanRemove=Remove plans
|Keyed.DesignatorPlanRemoveDesc=Remove planning designations.
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaHomeExpand=Expand home area
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaHomeExpandDesc=Colonists will repair buildings, clean floors, and extinguish fires only in the home area.
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaHomeClear=Clear home area
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaHomeClearDesc=Removes a home area. Colonists will no longer clean, repair, or extinguish fires here.
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaBuildRoofExpand=Expand build roof area
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaBuildRoofExpandDesc=Colonists will build roofs in this area.
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaBuildRoofClear=Clear build roof area
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaBuildRoofClearDesc=Remove the area where colonists will build roofs. Existing roofs will remain, but colonists won't build more.
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaNoRoofExpand=Expand no roof area
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaNoRoofExpandDesc=Colonists will remove roofs in this area (except overhead mountain, which cannot be removed).
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaNoRoofClear=Clear no roof area
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaNoRoofClearDesc=Removes no-roof area, so colonists will no longer remove roofs.
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaSnowClearExpand=Expand snow clear area
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaSnowClearExpandDesc=Create a area which colonists will try to keep clear of snow.
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaSnowClearClear=Clear snow clear Area
|Keyed.DesignatorAreaSnowClearClearDesc=Removes a snow clearing area. Colonists will no longer try to keep this area clear of snow.
|Keyed.DesignatorExpandAreaAllowed=Expand allowed area
|Keyed.DesignatorExpandAreaAllowedDesc=Expand an allowed area.<br/><br/>Allowed areas are defined areas you can assign to colonists. Colonists will not accept work or fulfill their needs outside their allowed area.
|Keyed.DesignatorClearAreaAllowed=Clear allowed area
|Keyed.DesignatorClearAreaAllowedDesc=Clear cells from an allowed area.<br/><br/>Allowed area are defined areas you can assign to colonists. Colonists will not accept work or fulfill their needs outside their allowed area.
|Keyed.ManageAreas=Manage areas...
|Keyed.DesignatorGrowingZoneDesc=Create a zone where your colonists will try to grow a certain kind of plant.
|Keyed.DesignatorZoneCreateStorageResourcesDesc=Create a stockpile where your colonists will store resources.<br/>This tool can also expand any existing stockpile.
|Keyed.DesignatorZoneCreateStorageDumpingDesc=Create a stockpile where your colonists will store junk.<br/>This tool can also expand any existing stockpile.
|Keyed.DesignatorZoneDelete=Delete zones
|Keyed.DesignatorZoneDeleteDesc=Remove zones, like stockpile zones or growing zones.
|Keyed.DesignatorClaim=Claim
|Keyed.DesignatorClaimDesc=Claim neutral structures for the colony, including ancient ruins and abandoned siege bases. Claimed structures can be repaired and maintained by your colonists.
|Keyed.DesignatorRemoveFloor=Remove floor
|Keyed.DesignatorRemoveFloorDesc=Remove floors to reveal the terrain underneath.
|Keyed.DesignatorStrip=Strip
|Keyed.DesignatorStripDesc=Strip apparel from corpses and the wounded.
|Keyed.DesignatorRearmTrap=Rearm trap
|Keyed.DesignatorRearmTrapDesc=Rearm a sprung trap so it can be triggered again.
|Keyed.DesignatorOpen=Open
|Keyed.DesignatorOpenDesc=Open full graves or containers.
|Keyed.DesignatorSlaughter=Slaughter
|Keyed.DesignatorSlaughterDesc=Slaughter a tame animal.
|Keyed.DesignatorTame=Tame
|Keyed.DesignatorTameDesc=Tame a wild animal.

|Keyed.GameUpdatedToNewVersionInitial=RimWorld has been updated from version {0} to version {1}.
|Keyed.GameUpdatedToNewVersionSavesIncompatible=This may cause saved games and mods from the old version to stop working.
|Keyed.GameUpdatedToNewVersionSavesCompatible=Saved games from the old version should be compatible, however some mods may stop working.
|Keyed.GameUpdatedToNewVersionNonSteam=Since this is a DRM-free copy, you can install the game twice in two different folders, to be able to play both old and new versions.
|Keyed.GameUpdatedToNewVersionSteam=If you wish to continue with the old version, you can opt in using Steam's "Betas" feature.<br/><br/>  1. In the Steam library, right-click RimWorld.<br/>  2. Click Properties.<br/>  3. Click the Betas tab.<br/>  4. Select the version you want from the drop-down menu.<br/><br/>Old versions will be likely removed from this list eventually - we just didn't want to cut off games in progress.<br/><br/>Note that if mod authors update their mods for a new game version, they'll probably stop working on an old version. You may want to turn off automatic updates to prevent this.
|Keyed.RecoveredFromErrorsDialogTitle=Recovered from incompatible or corrupted mods errors
|Keyed.RecoveredFromErrorsText=It seems that some of the active mods were causing errors.<br/><br/>They were incompatible with each other, designed for a different version of RimWorld, or corrupted.<br/><br/>All mods have been disabled and can be activated again in the mods dialog.
|Keyed.ErrorWhileLoadingAssetsTitle=Error while loading assets
|Keyed.ErrorWhileLoadingAssets=An error occurred while loading game assets. See error log for more information.
|Keyed.ErrorWhileLoadingAssets_ModsInfo=The game is currently running with custom mods - they may or may not cause these problems.
|Keyed.ErrorWhileGeneratingMapTitle=Error while generating a map

|Keyed.ErrorWhileLoadingMapTitle=Error while loading a map
|Keyed.ErrorWhileLoadingMap=An error occurred while loading a map. See error log for more information.
|Keyed.ModsChanged=The mod list has changed. The game will now restart automatically.
|Keyed.FailedToRestart=Something went wrong while restarting the game. The game can't fully unload modified code from deactivated mods, so code from deactivated mods may still be active.<br/><br/>It's recommended that you quit and restart the game now to load all mods cleanly.
|Keyed.Restarting=Restarting
|Keyed.SteamClientMissing=Could not initialize Steam API. Possible causes:<br/><br/>-Steam is not running.<br/>-Launched from outside Steam without steam_appid.txt in place.<br/>-Running with different privileges than Steam client (e.g. "as administrator").<br/><br/>In most cases, rebooting your computer will fix this problem.<br/><br/>You can play anyway, but no Steam stats will be recorded and Steam features won't be available.
